snippet: Unemployment fell to 7.8 percent from 8.1 percent, reaching its lowest level since President Obama took office and crossing what had become a symbolic threshold in the campaign.
abstract: Labor Department report finds unemployment dropped to 7.8 percent in September, the lowest level since the month Pres Obama took office; employers added 114,000 jobs in September and estimates for July and August were revised upward; report indicates a steadier economic recovery than previously thought and threatens Mitt Romney's argument that Pres Obama has failed as an economic steward.

byline.original: By SHAILA DEWAN and MARK LANDLER
byline.contributor: John H. Cushman Jr. contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Unemployment fell to 7.8 percent from 8.1 percent, reaching its lowest level since President Obama took office and crossing what had become a symbolic threshold in the campaign.

headline.main: Drop in Jobless Figure Gives Jolt to Race for President
headline.print_headline: Jobless Rate Sinks to 7.8%, Its Lowest for Obama's Term
